intro: Verbascum henriquesii var. compositum, commonly known as the composite mullein, is a perennial plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to rock gardens. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in Mediterranean climates.
